comments.commentBody: The Trump base denies facts, denies reality, denies climate science, denies the value of education and experience. And now we are finding out it also denies our common humanity.  They are willing to accept the vile motivations that Trump represents in order to defend white male privilege. These people will not just disappear after the election. Will the Republican party ever repudiate them? No. The GOP is now the party of stupid.  It remains to be seen for how long they'll continue to paralyze the government and hold the country hostage to stupidity.

It is frustrating to see the false equivalency comparison of the candidates.
Nothing in Hillary Clintons long career in public service compares to the
debauchery, abuse of power, and sexist behavior of Trump.
The decades of misinformation and hyped "scandals" has been successful and
that is sad. I just can't get spun up about Hillary's private email server with some
staff emails blah blah. I didn't hear much about General Petreus' probation
sentence for intentionally sharing classified information for example.
The conservatives hypocritical stance is off the charts

Here's a history lesson on the difference between Republican and Democrat governing. Google, then choose.

PoliticsThatWork.com Change in Unemployment Rate by Party of President- Since 1945

Each party has held the presidency for the same number of years since 1945. During those years, the unemployment rate has risen 11.8% under Republican presidents and has fallen 7.2% under Democratic presidents. Unemployment has fallen during the overwhelming majority of Democratic years since 1949. Unemployment rose steadily under Republicans up until 1982, then fell during the remaining Reagan years, and then rose again under both Bush Presidents.

PoliticsThatWork.com Dow Jones Performance by the Party of the President

During the most recent 15 years during which Republicans have held the presidency, the value of the Dow has increased by 42%. During the Democratic presidencies, it has increased by 609%- 14.5 times faster. The average growth in the value of the Dow under Democrats during this period has been 14.75% and under Republicans it has been 5.11%.

PoliticsThatWork.com Change in Disposable Income Since 1930 by the Party of the President

In the 44 years that we have had Democratic presidents since 1930, the real per-capita disposable income has increased 271%. During the 40 years during which we have had Republican presidents, it has increased 44%. On average, it has increased 3.1% (after adjusting for inflation) under Democratic presidents and 1% under Republican presidents.

"But there aren’t yet many signs that the bottom has fallen out for either Mr. Trump or the Republican Senate..."

Seriously? The man is on tape bragging about his ability to sexually assault women without consequence. And now the women are coming out of the woodwork, ten so far. Do you think it'll stop at ten? The man is 70! That's 50+ years of lechery about to blow up in October of an election year.

No, there will be more women with stories about Trump. The stories will be worse than what we we've already heard.

No politician could survive this, not even good, competent ones. Make no mistake about it, the bottom has fallen out of Trump's campaign!

Turnout is going to be key. If Democrats get out their base, they will sweep. Since they actually have vigorous GOTV programs in place, compared to Trump's none, they may get more voters to the polls. It's then that the GOP's vigorous programs of voter disenfranchisement will come into play. How many Democratic votes can they discourage, prevent being cast, or get thrown out?

Of course, the vote tallies may not matter at all. Trump is convincing his base that there is no way he can legitimately lose. When the votes sbreak against him, they will rise up on rage and disbelief. Trump will then challenge the election results in every swing state that he loses, claiming that he is only following the will of his supporters.

This is the hell to which our democracy has been brought by a campaign detached from facts, dominated by money and celebrity, and reported by ratings-chasers.

I suspect that Clinton's unpopularity also comes into play, that will also factor in her not having any real coattails. Trump will and up with a popular vote in the Mid-30% range and Clinton will win with less than 50% of the popular vote with the rest of the vote going to Gary Johnson, Jill Stein, Evan McMullin, Mickey Mouse, Mom and Deez Nuts!

It seems there are a number of Republicans who are saying
""Donald Trump may be a scumbag, but he is our scumbag"

Why would the women coming forward be fabricating their claims of assault? I admire them. They have courage. They have nothing to gain personally. Indeed, it can't be easy for a private citizen to have your name splashed across the media, to have people brand you a liar (or worse), and to deal with upsetting comments from vicious emailers and Internet/Twitter trolls.

"But the more relevant question now is whether he will lose by a landslide margin and in the sort of wave that would swamp Republicans in the Senate and even jeopardize Republican control of the House."
Let's hope so! Its ironic to me that many of us blame the mainstream media such as the NYT for enabling a Donald Trump, a Sarah Palin and other "deplorables" while Trump himself in an act of massive denial, blames the media for taking him down. Donald doesn't want to take responsibility for the fact that he started the dismal dump this whole election cycle has descended into. He took HRC on in a game of hardball character assignation, and is only reaping the whirlwind of what he created. In true Orwellian fashion, Trump re-invents history anew at each of his rallies. But now that people are actually paying attention, the charade is over. I predict that by next year we will see Mr. Trump doing infomercials on cable as another charlatan is assigned to the scrap heap of history.

Why does anyone think that there are no more disgusting revelations to appear?  They have been on the Democratic shelf for months, but they have not been needed as the Republican nominee does himself in with no help from the opposition.  Wikileaks has been a total bust in spite of their boasts of blockbuster reveals to come.  The only October surprises will be yet more terrible things about Trump, as the calendar ticks down against any response from the Republican nominee.

The Republican's should have wiped Hillary off the map in this election given all of her negatives.  Unfortunately the Republicans nominated on the few people who could lose this election.  However, that doesn't mean there's a groundswell of support or Hillary.

“The possibility that they (undecided and minor-party voters) could disproportionately break to Mrs. Clinton — and the Democrats — seems very plausible.” Ya' think?

A more likely possibility is that they will just stay home, underwhelmed by the lack of substance and disgusted by the tone of this election.

replies.commentBody: Well, I admire your optimism, but your hopes are not realistic.

comments.commentBody:
Landslide, landslide, landslide! Good for this nation and good for the earth! Minimum 70 Dems US Senate and minimum 300 Dems US House Reps and minimum 30 Dems Governors and take back all State legislatures 2016! Take back NC, AK, PA, WY, TN, AZ, NH, NV, OH, WI, CO, FL, ND, SC, WV, IL, ID, IA 2016.

Then no more bigotry, misogyny, racism, obstructionism, filibusters, Corporations United, Heller vs DC, wasted taxpayer monies on so called investigations, and on and on. And NO we don't want a check on the Clinton White House!

Tell ALL you know to vote ONLY Democrat 2016 and shove the Republican'ts and deplorables so far down that they will never recover and end up in the trash heap of history where they belong.

I think it is important to remember Nate's comments about delayed reactions.  As an extreme example, after the passage of the Civil Rights Act in the 1960's a large number of southern white voters couldn't forgive the Democrats.  However, it took them over 50 years to complete their move over to the Republican Party and for the GOP to adapt to the needs of their new members.  If the GOP retains power next year in the House, it's going to be extremely difficult for them to maintain party discipline.  I suspect that the internal war in the GOP will go on for several years.

As Trump knows very well, going broke Is a process of slowly wearing away creditor's faith, then one is left suddenly to the vultures. He has put his faith in Putin and the black swan from Julian. I doubt they will put their faith in him. Donald is used to being in the bus, not under it.

The Russians are attempting to influence this election by hacking computer servers and selectively disclosing e-mails to the public. Is it not also possible that Russian interests are at work influencing the vast number of polls that are gauging the election? Just a thought.
Which proves how truly awful most people think Hillary Clinton is.

Could pollster now be hitting a wall of rationalization?  Some voters might be groping (pun intended) for ways to excuse Trump's behavior.  If they can hear him brag about molesting women and still want to vote for him, then they'll dismiss any other evidence against him.  Perhaps their throwing a rotten egg at Washington might be their best solution.
What worries me is Brexit - most - city Brits at least -  thought it impossible that it would pass.   So feel only cautious optimism about 'end of Trump'

As much as I try, I cannot understand the undecided in this election. It feels like George W. Bush's line "You're either with us or against us" should apply here. I can't believe anyone who will be voting could still be on the sideline. What about this election could give you any place for gray?

replies.commentBody:
You are exactly correct. They are his boot licking sycophants now.
And they are dangerous.

comments.commentBody: The Trump followers that are left have devolved into a cult. The worse a person Trump is revealed to be, the more they like him. Trump understood his sway with this contingent early on when said that they'd stick by him even if he shot someone on 5th Ave. in NY. Intervention anyone?
The biggest Republican firewall is the 2010 gerymandered House redistricting that has ensured control of the House, even though the Democrats have a larger cumulative vote total.
The Trump coalition is now officially a cult. Trump is Jim Jones.

It would be a very powerful and positive statement to utterly bury Trump and his party, which still largely supports him.  A landslide against Trump would state clearly both to ourselves and to the world that some things are more important than party politics. Basic human decency in how we conduct ourselves as Americans for one thing.  Respect for ourselves.  Respect for women.  Respect for minorities.  Just basic respect.  A vote for Trump is a vote AGAINST basic civility.  So do i expect this result, an unambiguous denouncement? Sadly, not really.  Ultimately we ARE a divided nation and no matter HOW repellant Trump is I feel like he will get 40% of the vote simply because he IS the republican nominee.  I will be delighted to be wrong though.  If all the women who have been assaulted by Trump continue to speak out and make clear to all republicans that this man is simply unacceptable as a symbol of our country...maybe...just maybe they will overcome their hatred of liberals, democrats, etc and refuse to vote for this truly repellant individual.  Only time will tell for sure.

Now why would certain Republicans on one hand scorn Trump for acting out his various evils and yet still support his nomination? What would they have to gain?

It is pretty much accepted that Trump in office would create an economic and global catastrophe. Big money would lose big, in some cases everything. But, unless big money has control of this country which it does via the bought and paid for Republican Party, big money would be certain to lose certain amounts of money if the Democrats come into control of the US government. Also, having control of the presidency would have a trickle down affect for other key positions in our government, such as the Supreme Court.

So, first of all, it is imperative that the Republicans acquire and maintain control of the US government. Since the only real chance of doing that is to support Trump…so be it. Act all disgusted with Trump but underneath take actions that would continue to put Trump into office. But to leave Trump in office will lead to the inevitable collapse of the known world. So Trump would have to go away…somehow! With Trump on a permanent hiatus, that would then leave the next in line for the presidency and of course that would be whoever is in the Vice President slot…Pence. President Pence. Pence has already shown his support for Koch like government.
Trump would need to take the presidency but go on vacation before he had made any decisions on who to put into those support offices…like SCOTUS.

NO TRUMP
